items.title: Warner Bros. Begins Exclusive Negotiations With Netflix
items.standfirst: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. has entered exclusive negotiations to sell its film and TV studios and HBO Max streaming service to Netflix Inc., according to people familiar with the discussions. The two companies could announce a deal as soon as in the coming days, assuming talks don’t fall apart, the people said. Bloomberg’s Manuel Baigorri breaks down the situation.
items.content: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. has entered exclusive negotiations to sell its film and TV studios and HBO Max streaming service to Netflix Inc., according to people familiar with the discussions. The two companies could announce a deal as soon as in the coming days, assuming talks don’t fall apart, the people said. Bloomberg’s Manuel Baigorri breaks down the situation.

clusters.title: At least 4 countries pull out of 2026 Eurovision contest over Israel's participation
clusters.neutral_headline: Multiple Countries Boycott Eurovision Over Israel's Participation

items.title: At least 4 countries pull out of 2026 Eurovision contest over Israel's participation
items.standfirst: Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia said they were pulling out of the contest after organizers decided to allow Israel to continue to compete, despite tensions over its conduct in Gaza.
items.content: Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia said they were pulling out of the contest after organizers decided to allow Israel to continue to compete, despite tensions over its conduct in Gaza.(Image credit: Martin Meissner)

items.title: Israel “art-washing its war crimes” through Eurovision

items.content: Dorien Ballout on the boycott by the Netherlands and other countries of Eurovision 2026 after Israel allowed to compete.

items.title: Four countries to boycott Eurovision 2026 as Israel cleared to compete
items.standfirst: Ireland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands pull out after decision not to hold vote on Israel’s participationIreland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands will boycott next year’s Eurovision after Israel was given the all-clear to compete in the 2026 song contest despite calls by several participating broadcasters for its exclusion over the war in Gaza.No vote on Israel’s participation was held on Thursday at the general assembly of the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), the body that organises the competition. Continue reading...
items.content: Ireland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands pull out after decision not to hold vote on Israel’s participationIreland, Spain, Slovenia and the Netherlands will boycott next year’s Eurovision after Israel was given the all-clear to compete in the 2026 song contest despite calls by several participating broadcasters for its exclusion over the war in Gaza.No vote on Israel’s participation was held on Thursday at the general assembly of the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), the body that organises the competition. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain, and Slovenia will boycott Eurovision 2026.
The boycott follows the decision to allow Israel to compete in the contest.
The decision was made despite calls for Israel's exclusion due to the war in Gaza.
No vote was held on Israel's participation at the EBU general assembly.
Some broadcasters cited unfair voting accusations as a reason for the boycott.

items.standfirst: The 30-year-old Virginia resident evaded capture for years after authorities discovered pipe bombs planted near buildings in Washington, DC, the day before the January 6, 2021, Capitol attack.
items.content: The 30-year-old Virginia resident evaded capture for years after authorities discovered pipe bombs planted near buildings in Washington, DC, the day before the January 6, 2021, Capitol attack.

items.title: Defence, oil and trade imbalances: Putin in India to boost economic ties
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin has landed in India for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the first time since the start of the war in Ukraine. The visit aims at strengthening economic ties between Moscow and New Delhi. Also, Italian police visit the headquarters of 13 major fashion brands as part of an investigation into luxury good supply chains. Plus, hundreds queue up in Auckland for Ikea's grand opening.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has landed in India for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the first time since the start of the war in Ukraine. The visit aims at strengthening economic ties between Moscow and New Delhi. Also, Italian police visit the headquarters of 13 major fashion brands as part of an investigation into luxury good supply chains. Plus, hundreds queue up in Auckland for Ikea's grand opening.

items.title: Hugs and greetings: Vladimir Putin has just arrived in India for talks with Modi
items.standfirst: There were warm hugs on the tarmac as Vladimir Putin arrived in New Delhi on December 4, with both leaders breaking protocol to signal the importance of the visit. The Russian president is in India for talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with economic ties and their wider geopolitical partnership high on the agenda. Navodia Kumari has more from New Delhi.
items.content: There were warm hugs on the tarmac as Vladimir Putin arrived in New Delhi on December 4, with both leaders breaking protocol to signal the importance of the visit. items.title: New US military strike on suspected drug boat heightens scrutiny of Trump anti-trafficking campaign
items.standfirst: The US military on Thursday carried out another strike on a small boat in the eastern Pacific Ocean – its first in nearly three weeks – as congressional concern deepens over the legality and conduct of President Donald Trump’s aggressive anti-drug campaign at sea.
items.content: The US military on Thursday carried out another strike on a small boat in the eastern Pacific Ocean – its first in nearly three weeks – as congressional concern deepens over the legality and conduct of President Donald Trump’s aggressive anti-drug campaign at sea.

items.title: Pentagon announces it has killed four men in another boat strike in Pacific
items.standfirst: Strike comes amid congressional turmoil over legality of US attacks on suspected drug smugglersThe Pentagon announced on Thursday that the US military had conducted another deadly strike on a boat suspected of carrying illegal narcotics, killing four men in the eastern Pacific, as questions mount over the legality of the attacks.Video of the new strike was posted on social media by the US southern command, based in Florida, with a statement saying that, at the direction of Pete Hegseth, the defense secretary, “Joint Task Force Southern Spear conducted a lethal kinetic strike on a vessel in international waters operated by a Designated Terrorist Organization”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Police 'naturally' recover a $19,000 Fabergé egg swallowed by alleged thief

items.title: Police 'naturally' recover a $19,000 Fabergé egg swallowed by alleged thief
items.standfirst: Police in New Zealand said Friday that they had recovered a Fabergé egg pendant worth $19,000, six days after a man was accused of swallowing it at a jewelry store in an effort to steal it
items.content: Police in New Zealand said Friday that they had recovered a Fabergé egg pendant worth $19,000, six days after a man was accused of swallowing it at a jewelry store in an effort to steal it

items.title: Stolen Fabergé pendant passed to police - quite literally
items.standfirst: A Fabergé pendant has been recovered - after police spent six days closely monitoring the man accused of swallowing it.
items.content: A Fabergé pendant has been recovered - after police spent six days closely monitoring the man accused of swallowing it.

items.title: Patient police say they have recovered Fabergé pendant from man accused of swallowing it
items.standfirst: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention. Continue reading...
items.content: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention. clusters.title: US Supreme Court allows Texas to use redrawn district map for 2026 midterms
clusters.neutral_headline: Supreme Court Allows Texas to Use Redrawn Map

items.title: US Supreme Court allows Texas to use redrawn district map for 2026 midterms
items.standfirst: The new Texas map, backed by Donald Trump, has sparked similar efforts for partisan redistricting across the US.
items.content: The new Texas map, backed by Donald Trump, has sparked similar efforts for partisan redistricting across the US.

items.title: US Supreme Court approves Texas's Republican-friendly electoral map for 2026 midterms
items.standfirst: The US Supreme Court on Thursday allowed Texas to use its newly redrawn congressional districts for the 2026 midterms, a major win for President Donald Trump’s Republican Party that could reshape the battle for control of the House and accelerate a wave of politically charged redistricting across the country.
items.content: The US Supreme Court on Thursday allowed Texas to use its newly redrawn congressional districts for the 2026 midterms, a major win for President Donald Trump’s Republican Party that could reshape the battle for control of the House and accelerate a wave of politically charged redistricting across the country.

items.title: Supreme Court allows Texas GOP to use new redistricted map for now
items.standfirst: Texas approved a new congressional map this summer after Trump urged state GOP lawmakers to craft new House district lines to help Republicans hold onto their majority in the 2026 midterms.
items.content: Texas approved a new congressional map this summer after Trump urged state GOP lawmakers to craft new House district lines to help Republicans hold onto their majority in the 2026 midterms.

items.title: Supreme Court lets Texas use gerrymandered map that could give GOP 5 more House seats
items.standfirst: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for a Texas congressional map that may help the GOP win five more U.S. House seats in the 2026 midterms. A lower court found the map is likely unconstitutional.
items.content: The Supreme Court has cleared the way for a Texas congressional map that may help the GOP win five more U.S. House seats in the 2026 midterms. A lower court found the map is likely unconstitutional.(Image credit: Eric Gay)

ai_summary: The Supreme Court allowed Texas to use its new congressional map.
The map could give the GOP five more House seats.
The map was approved after Trump urged state GOP lawmakers.
A lower court found the map is likely unconstitutional.
The decision could reshape the battle for control of the House.

items.standfirst: Putin, on visit to India, says Russia is ready to continue to provide uninterrupted fuel supplies to the countryAnalysis: Putin and Modi to meet amid politically treacherous times for Russia and IndiaRussia and India will reshape their defence ties to take account of New Delhi’s push for self-reliance, the two countries said in a joint statement after a summit between president Putin and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi.“In response to India’s aspirations for self-reliance, the partnership is currently being reoriented toward joint research and development, as well as the production of advanced defence platforms,” the statement said. Continue reading...

items.title: Live: Macron calls for increasing pressure on Russian economy on last day of China visit
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday called for increased pressure on the Russian economy over its war in Ukraine on the last day of his state visit to China, a key Russian ally. Meanwhile in India, visiting Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow was ready to continue providing New Delhi with "uninterrupted" Russian fuel shipments. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

clusters.title: Israeli-backed, anti-Hamas Palestinian militia chief Abu Shabab killed in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli-Backed Militia Leader Killed in Gaza

items.title: Israeli-backed, anti-Hamas Palestinian militia chief Abu Shabab killed in Gaza
items.standfirst: Yasser Abu Shabab, a Bedouin clan chief and leader of an armed Palestinian militia opposed to Hamas, was killed in Gaza while trying to resolve a family dispute, his group said. The Israeli-backed Popular Forces in Gaza on Thursday denied "misleading" reports that Hamas was behind Abu Shabab's killing.
items.content: Yasser Abu Shabab, a Bedouin clan chief and leader of an armed Palestinian militia opposed to Hamas, was killed in Gaza while trying to resolve a family dispute, his group said. The Israeli-backed Popular Forces in Gaza on Thursday denied "misleading" reports that Hamas was behind Abu Shabab's killing.

items.title: Prominent anti-Hamas militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab killed in Gaza
items.standfirst: His Popular Forces group says Abu Shabab was shot while attempting to resolve a family dispute and not killed by Hamas.
items.content: His Popular Forces group says Abu Shabab was shot while attempting to resolve a family dispute and not killed by Hamas.

items.title: Yasser abu Shabab, leader of Israel-backed militia, killed in Gaza
items.standfirst: Death of commander of Popular Forces is blow to Israel’s efforts to confront Hamas through proxy groupsThe leader of an Israeli-backed militia in Gaza has been killed, dealing a major blow to Israel’s efforts to build up its own Palestinian proxies to confront Hamas.Yasser abu Shabab, a Bedouin tribal leader based in the Israeli-held zone of the devastated territory, is thought to have died from wounds sustained in a violent clash with powerful and well-armed local families, according to local media and sources in Gaza. Continue reading...
items.content: Death of commander of Popular Forces is blow to Israel’s efforts to confront Hamas through proxy groupsThe leader of an Israeli-backed militia in Gaza has been killed, dealing a major blow to Israel’s efforts to build up its own Palestinian proxies to confront Hamas.Yasser abu Shabab, a Bedouin tribal leader based in the Israeli-held zone of the devastated territory, is thought to have died from wounds sustained in a violent clash with powerful and well-armed local families, according to local media and sources in Gaza. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Yasser Abu Shabab, an anti-Hamas militia leader, was killed in Gaza.
Abu Shabab's group said he was killed while resolving a family dispute.
The Popular Forces group is backed by Israel.
The death is a blow to Israel's efforts to confront Hamas.
Local media sources suggest he died in a violent clash.
